intro: Turraea schliebenii, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and Eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dark, aromatic wood and smooth, glossy leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and produces small yellow flowers followed by orange-red fruits. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated for horticultural purposes.
